project.Title: Technical Assistance for the Gambia Sustainable Energy Project
Description: AZOROM is supporting the Government of The Gambia under EIB funding to set-up and, initially, assist in running a dedicated ProjectCo which will function as a PIU. Furthermore, the objective is to realise and operate a portfolio of off-grid solar photovoltaic (PV) energy systems with battery backup in up to 1,100 primary and secondary education schools and health facilities in the country. The PIU will be responsible for the co-ordination and successful delivery of all activities under the Project, including procurement and cooperation between the representatives of the relevant authorities on the project sites and the contractors. The overall objective of the project of which this contract will be a part is as follows: To provide stable and reliable electricity supply to a maximum of 100 on-grid and off-grid health facilities in the country and a maximum of 1,000 on-grid and off-grid public schools facilities. The Project will install solar PV with battery backup equipment in schools and health clinics in The Gambia, and possibly it will provide limited electricity services in neighbouring communities without access to the grid.

project.Title: Expert Technical Services for Monitoring and Reporting of Gas & Electricity Infrastructure, Ireland
Description: Azorom was retained by the Sustainable Energy Authority of Ireland (SEAI) to perform the technical monitoring task, on behalf of Ireland as the Member State of the EU, for the certifying of claims for energy projects in receipt of funding under the European Unionâ€™s Connecting Europe Facility (CEF). The Framework may also be used to provide other technical analyses and studies on electricity, gas and energy infrastructure and gas safety issues, on an as-needed basis.

project.Title: Program Implementation Unit (PIU), Ghana
Description: The Millennium Development Authority (MiDA) is the independent Ghanaian entity accountable for overall management of an MCC (USA) funded compact program investing approx. US$500 million in electricity infrastructure and services in Ghana.   MiDA engaged the services of AZOROM to establish and operate a Program Implementation Unit (PIU) to provide over-arching program and project management support and co-ordination to the MiDA management and Project Directorates/Teams. The PIU will also work closely and collaborate with Implementing Contractors and other consultants engaged by MiDA. Funded by MCC.

project.Title: Implementation of a Regulatory Information Management System at ERA, Uganda
Description: Azorom is a member of a consulting partnership retained to support the Energy Regulatory Authority (ERA) in implementing an information management system as well as the procurement of required software and hardware for the purpose of information collection, regulatory analysis, compliance monitoring, decision making and other regulatory functions. Funded by kfw.

project.Title: LEC Training Center Program Design, Liberia
Description: Azorom was retained to provide advisory services to establish a training center to enable the Liberian electricity utility LEC to deliver high-quality, fit-for-purpose training to its staff to ensure they are able to fulfill the needs of the corporation and support a well-functioning electricity utility. Funded by MCC.

project.Title: Definition, Procurement & Supervision of the Implementation of an ERP System for ECG, Ghana
Description: Azorom is a member of a consulting partnership retained to define an ERP solution that permits a consolidation of information holdings and a move to a new paradigm service orientation for integrated service delivery involving the following three phases of work:

• Pre-ERP Study, Definition of System Requirements, Launch Solicitation Docs
  • Solicitation of ERP Contractor
  • Oversight Service and Supervision
Funded by MCC

project.Title: Safety Advisory Services to ESB the National Electricity Utility, Ireland
Description: Azorom has been awarded a framework contract which includes the following scope of work:
Assistance and support in complying with its legal obligations in respect of its role and responsibilities under Safety Health and Welfare at Work Act  ( S.I. No. 291 of 2013)
Provision of safety advisors with the experience and qualifications to meet ESB Networks requirements.
Coordinate Gap analysis in relation to ESB Networks Safety documentation

• Update and amend Safety documents as necessary
  • Monitor performance, including safety performance, of Safety Advisors
  • Coordinate and facilitate shared learning and training of Safety Advisors

project.Title: Technical Adviser for Development of 60 MWp Solar Power Plant, Chad
Description: AZOROM is providing technical advice to a private developer in Chad for the development of a 60MWp solar plant. Tasks include:

• Preparation of tender documents and selection of the EPC contractor
  • Preparation of tender documents and selection of the O&M contractor
  • Drafting of the EPC and O&M contracts
  • Preparation of financial models
  • Review of ESIA reports

project.Title: Monitoring of Management Contractor for LEC, Liberia
Description: AZOROM is providing support to MCA-Liberia to

• evaluate the performance of the Management Contractor in accordance with its terms and conditions as they may exist from time to time throughout the Term of the MSC
  • advise MCA-Liberia with respect to all related matters, so that MCA-Liberia can make timely decisions with respect to all disbursements under the management contract
  • assist in resolving any disagreement or dispute between the parties.

project.Title: Development of Integrated Strategic Plan at ESCOM, Malawi
Description: AZOROM is assisting ESCOM develop a robust integrated strategic plan for coming 4 years (ISP21). The process will allow the Malawi Government, project partners, ESCOM Board, ESCOM Executive Management and staff and other key stakeholders to not only have a guiding document for the next 4 years in the development of the power sector, but also take stock of the Corporation's effectiveness in implementing of the ISP17 by looking at the immediate past, current situation, emerging dynamics, government policies and offer suggestions for the strategic direction for the 4-year plan.

project.Title: Consultant Services to NAWEC, The Gambia
Description: AZOROM is providing support to NAWEC over a 4 year period to become an efficiently operating and commercially viable enterprise. To achieve that, expert services will be provided in the following areas: Organizational improvement; Improving commercial performance; Improving financial performance and reporting; Demand-side management and reactive power assistance; Technical performance improvement; Definition, procurement and deployment of Integrated Management System; Preparation of pre-feasibility study report for IMS; Definition of IMS, TOR and Technical Requirements; Procurement and deployment of IMS; Develop and implement. capacity-building/training program

project.Title: Support to Energy Regulator (ERA), Uganda
Description: Working with ERA to enhance its internal capacities for power system analysis, technical regulation, economic regulation, legal and procedural aspects of regulation of DISCOs and TRANSCOs, environmental aspects of regulation of DISCOs and TRANSCOs, understanding of other regulatory regimes and broader aspects of regulation of the ESI.Funded by kfw

project.Title: Due Diligence for Private Sector Investment in Power Sector, Sierra Leone
Description: AZOROM is providing technical services to a private client looking at investing in the power sector of Sierra Leone. Work involves technical due diligence of the networks, review of performance of power companies and development of financial models and analysis of options for private sector participation.

project.Title: Technical Support to Development of Power Business, Democratic Republic of Congo
Description: AZOROM is providing technical services to a private client developing a power generation and distribution business in an un-electrified area of DRC. Provision of technical, financial and commercial advice.

project.Title: Solar Farm Technical and Connection Services, Ireland
Description: AZOROM is providing technical services to a number of private investors looking at investment in grid connected solar farms in Ireland ranging in size from 4MW to 25MW. Evaluation of technical constraints and development of technically competent grid connections at best value for money. Processing of grid connection applications.

project.Title: Solar Power Development Prefeasibility Study, Sierra Leone
Description: AZOROM carried out a study to identify the options for the rollout of utility-scale solar power plants in multiple locations in Sierra Leone and the options for the rollout of small-scale off-grid private sector-led solar power initiatives nationwide. Also, identified the potential financing sources for the further funding of the feasibility study and policy work of the identified national solar power rollout options. AZOROM prepared tender documents to go to the market for a number of solar PV grid connected farms. The project was funded by DFID.

project.Title: Financial  & Operational Turnaround Consultancy, Malawi
Description: AZOROM is working with ESCOM the national electricity utility of Malawi to restore financial health and rebuild it into a financially strong, well-managed company. Technical assistance is being provided in areas of business planning, financial management, accounting and auditing, operational performance improvements including H&S, asset maintenance, work planning, DSM / EE, HR operations including staff performance monitoring and improvement, corporate governance support, and communications and public relations.The project is funded by the Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC).

project.Title: Training of Linesmen and Technicians, Malawi
Description: AZOROM is assisting ESCOM the national electrical utility of Malawi to establish a new training school for linesmen and technicians. It involves training needs analysis, development of training methodology, design of training facilities and course syllabus, development of training courses and manuals, specification and procurement of tools and equipment. AZOROM will carry out training of some 200 linesmen and technicians as part of the project. Funded by World Bank.

project.Title: Energy Efficiency in Government Buildings, Ireland
Description: AZOROM is supporting the Office of Public Works to implement a large scale Energy Conservation Campaign across up to 1,500 public service buildings in the Republic of Ireland, ranging from offices to schools, colleges and hospitals. The project aims to reduce energy costs in all Government buildings in Ireland by 20% and is on track to achieve this by 2016. This is Ireland's largest energy saving initiative.

project.Title: Supervising Consultant, Malawi
Description: AZOROM is providing technical services for the Millenniumm Challenge Corporation $260m investment in the rehabilitation and extension of the power system of Malawi. Services include: asset condition assessment, line and substation design, procurement, supervision of contractors during construction, development of a hazardous materials and waste management plan, health & safety program management during construction.The project was funded by the Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC).

project.Title: Establishment of a SBU in Ashanti Region of ECG, Ghana
Description: AZOROM is assisting ECG to establish a Strategic Business Unit in the Ashanti Region with institutional change management as the core element of the assignment. Carry out Diagnostic Baseline Studies covering: Business Management Capacity, Network condition, Work measurement, ICT adequacy and needs, Technical, Commercial, Financial operational procedures. Guide and support the Management in transitioning management & operational activities to the new SBU business model in the areas of: Technical Management; including development of a Maintenance Management Plan, a Network Master Plan, a Project Management Unit, a Project program and an optimum Procurement Management process. Commercial Management; including Metering, Billing, Revenue protection, service delivery, Call centre and operation and complaints handling. Financial Management; including Accounting and Financial management procedures, adequacy of Financial Management Information Systems, planning budgeting and performance reporting, cash handling and control, accounts payable and general governance. Preparation of a Strategic Business Plan, Annual Work Plans, Performance Monitoring Systems and a Management Information System. Funded by SECO, Switzerland.

project.Title: Rehabilitation of Hydro Power Plants, Ireland
Description: AZOROM is providing technical support to ESB the national electricity utility of Ireland in its programme of refurbishment of its hydro power plants. Work involves contract management, quality control, establishment of maintenance standards and procedures.

project.Title: Private Sector Participation in the Power Distribution Companies, Ghana
Description: AZOROM worked with IFC on behalf of MCC to assess the opportunities to introduce private sector participation in the distribution companies of Ghana. Undertake technical and financial due diligence of ECG and NEDCO, and due diligence on the legal and regulatory environment within which PSP can be implemented in Ghana's electricity distribution sector. Develop Options Analysis and identify the most appropriate form(s) and scope of PSP in Ghana's electricity distribution sector. Funded by World Bank.

project.Title: Sale of Power Plants, Nigeria
Description: AZOROM was retained by an investment consortium to develop its technical options and business plan for the purchase of a 750MW power plant in Nigeria. Work involved technical due diligence, estimation of operation and capital costs, staffing plan and investment plan.

project.Title: Performance Testing of Power Plants, Lebanon
Description: AZOROM carried out pre-upgrade and post-upgrade tests on a number of CCGT units for the power utility to ensure upgrade and rehabilitation work reached required standards. The company has also been involved in investigation and root cause analysis of a number of faults in power stations. Funded by World Bank.

project.Title: Support in Developing Peat to Power Projects, Rwanda
Description: AZOROM provided a range of expertise and technical assistance to the Government and EWSA the power and water utility in development and harvesting of peat bogs to generate electricity with development of 15MW and 100MW power plants. Assistance with energy policy development, planning of new power stations, peat sampling and analysis, negotiation with contractors, negotiation of PPAs, and supervision of work.

project.Title: Design of Power Supply for Phosphate Mine, Republic of Congo
Description: AZOROM provided technical advice to a private mining company related to power supply requirements for a phosphate mine undergoing feasibility studies including PFS and DFS and front end engineering. Analysis of forecasted loads and consumption. Design of technical and financial optimum solution for supplying power. Multicriteria analysis. Natural gas pipeline studies.

project.Title: Reduction of Technical and Commercial Losses, Tanzania
Description: AZOROM was retained under an MCC funded project to assist the power utilities Tanesco and Zeco to reduce their technical and commercial losses. The work involved:

• Calculation of total losses with breakdown between technical and commercial and allocation by voltage level and by region
  • Analysis of reasons for the losses and development of solutions to reduce the losses with economic analysis of investment required
  • Development and prioritization of priority projects based on economic return for a number of regions. Also, equipment specification and preparation of contract documents.
  • Implementation of quick-gain project involving installation of capacitors (design, procurement and installation supervision)

project.Title: Preparation of Business Plans for Purchase of Power Plants and Distribution Companies, Nigeria
Description: AZOROM provided assistance to a number of clients in their bids to purchase majority shareholding in power plants and distribution companies. The work consisted of due diligence of existing assets and operations, developing strategies, organization structures, staffing levels, efficiency improvement, costs reduction, investment requirements, economic analysis and financial statements.

project.Title: Development of Power Generation and Supply Business, Haiti
Description: AZOROM was retained by a private investor to provide assistance in developing a power business in Haiti. The project involved the various stages of investigation and analysis from concept to PFS to FS stages. Investigation of generation technology options and fuel availability, design of distribution lines and route selection, analysis of market and development of PPAs, permitting, environmental requirements, economic analysis, tariff structure and rates.

project.Title: Wholesale Electricity Market Metering and Settlement System, Kyrgyz Republic
Description: AZOROM undertook a review of proposed development of Wholesale Electricity Metering system including associated communications infrastructure and settlement system, project concept, bidding documents, technology options and costs. The project was funded by ADB.

project.Title: Chemical Analyses of Power Plants, Ireland
Description: AZOROM provided services to ESB Generation to carry out various chemical analyses required in its fossil fuel power plants (peat and coal).

project.Title: Design of Power Supplies for Special Economic Zones, Republic of Congo
Description: AZOROM carried out feasibility studies and outline design to deliver a secure and quality power supply to special economic zones in the RoC. Analysis of risks and mitigation measures for grid supply and self generation options with costing and economic analysis.

project.Title: Development of a Plan for Oil Management, Serbia
Description: AZOROM developed an oil management plan for Electromreza Srbije (EMS) the transmission, system and market operator on how to manage its transformer and circuit breaker oil under EuropeAid funding involving management of new and used oil and disposal of waste oil including environmental issues (PCBs, etc.)

project.Title: Design of Power Supply for Potash Mine, Republic of Congo
Description: AZOROM is providing technical advice to a private mining company related to power supply requirements for a potash mine undergoing feasibility studies including PFS and DFS. Analysis of forecasted loads and consumption. Design of technical and financial optimum solution for supplying power. Multicriteria analysis.

project.Title: Design of 400MW Power Supply for Iron Ore Mine, Republic of Congo
Description: AZOROM provided technical advice to a private mining company related to power supply requirements for iron ore mine under development. Power supplies required at mine site (380MW) port site (20MW). Investigation, outline design and costing of various options for power supply by new generation fuelled by natural gas, HFO, diesel oil or construction of 400kV line for some 360km with power purchase agreement. Power plant, HV/MV substation and distribution design and costing. Development of natural gas pipeline construction design and costs.

project.Title: Design of Power Supply Requirements, Kuwait
Description: AZOROM provided technical assistance to the State of Kuwait on the power supply requirements and the sources of power for the development of Boubyan Island. Power requirements will reach 1,000MW over 20 years. Work involves estimation of power demand and analysis of power supply options including development of power plant, power purchase, 400kV transmission cable and substation design, fuel options, use of renewables.

project.Title: Financial and Engineering Support Services to EdL of Lebanon
Description: Under this World Bank funded project AZOROM provided technical assistance to the national electricity utility of Lebanon EdL in order to improve its performance with a focus on technical issues (generation, transmission & distribution), procurement procedures, commercial operations and improvement of financial position. Projects carried out included: Development of Power Plant Improvement Plan; Development of Health & Safety Policies and Procedures; Improvement in Procurement Policies and Procedures; Technical Losses Study; Non-Technical Losses Study; Development of System Operations Policies and Procedures; Development of Budgetary Control Procedures; Development of Business & Investment Plans. Also, assisted in restructuring transition by: Participating in the review of reports prepared by consultants related to corporate restructuring and electricity trading arrangements; Ensuring the availability of reliable information to the corporate restructuring consultants

project.Title: Provision of Generation Training Services to ESB PowerGen, Ireland
Description: AZOROM provided training support to ESB Shared Services in provision of training to ESB PowerGen. Services included:

• Power plant operations training
  • Power plant maintenance training
  • Power plant management training
  • Mobile elevated working platforms training
  • Fork lift truck operator training
  • Health & Safety training

project.Title: Assistance in Establishing an Electricity Market in Serbia
Description: AZOROM provided assistance to Serbia's Ministry of Mining and Energy, the management of EPS and the management of the new Independent Transmission System and Market Operator (ITSMO) to establish, organise, and assist in the start up of the operations of the Independent Transmission, System and Market Operator, consistent with the Serbian Energy Law and requirements and deadlines agreed upon within the ECSEE process. The specific objectives of the project were to assist in the establishment and development of fully operational ITSMO with developed and approved codes, ready to participate in the regional electricity market with state of the art system operation and market operation software and trained staff. This project also restructured the existing vertically integrated monopoly and separated the transmission function into Transmission Operator and create as a separate entity the System Operator and Market Operator.

project.Title: Technical Assistance to the Energy and Water Utilities Regulatory Authority, Tanzania
Description: Under this World Bank funded project AZOROM provided technical assistance to the newly formed energy and water regulatory authority in reviewing the pricing submission by the national electricity utility TANESCO and assisted in establishing procedures for price reviews.

project.Title: Provision of Technical Support to ESB PowerGen, Ireland
Description: AZOROM provided specialist technical and project management expertise to assist ESB PowerGen at its largest power plant Moneypoint during implementation of large projects. Activities included:

• Review and assess current shortfalls in Station, Fuel & Ash areas
  • Co-ordinate Line Management Plans in improving Plant Reliability
  • Review Maintenance Programmes of work and drive their implementation
  • Provide training where identified as necessary
  • Contribute to MERP Project Installation and Commissioning
  • Co-ordinate work program to improve Electrical and C & I equipment reliability
  • Carry out Silo reliability study
  • Advise Station Management on MERP material/by-product handling
  • Co-ordinate Station refurbishment program
